speaker: Frasier
text: Our topic today has been honesty--the courage to face each other with the plain truth.  I've certainly enjoyed myself these last few hours, I hope you have too.  This is Dr. Frasier Crane, wishing you good mental health.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that was a dog of a show.

speaker: Roz
text: They all blend. [_picks up a message slip on Frasier's console_] Oh, you got a message.  A Blaine Sternin called--

speaker: Frasier
text: Blaine Sternin! [_gives her back the slip_] Call him back, tell him I'd dead!

speaker: Roz
text: [_rereads the slip_] Sternin?  Is he related to Lilith?

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, he's Lilith's half-brother, the curse of the family! What does it say when Lilith is the good one?

speaker: Roz
text: He sounded charming on the phone.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, of course he sounded charming.  Charm is the viscous grease with which he oils his flim-flam machine!  The man will say anything to get what he wants!

speaker: Roz
text: I can't believe I haven't dated this guy.

speaker: Frasier
text: The only reason he'd be contacting me is to separate me from my money.  The man is always coming with some sucker's sob story, while he's busy living the high life in Laughlin, Nevada! You know, he once stole from me a very precious antique: my 18th Century English salt server.

speaker: Roz
text: Well, if you don't mind Elvis, you can have mine. [_gives him back the slip_]

speaker: Frasier
text: [_looks at it_] Oh, dear God.

speaker: Roz
text: What?

speaker: Frasier
text: This number he left... it's local.  The beast walks among us. _FADE OUT  Scene Two - Apartment Martin, Niles, and Daphne are watching television.  Frasier rushes through the front door and slams it behind him._

speaker: Frasier
text: Don't answer the front door or the phone.  Lock all the windows.  Blaine Sternin is in Seattle!

speaker: Daphne
text: Who?

speaker: Martin
text: [_turns off the TV_] Lilith's half-brother.

speaker: Niles
text: Is he the scoundrel that walked off with your 18th Century salt cellar?

speaker: Frasier
text: The very same!

speaker: Daphne
text: Blaine Sternin.  A package came for you this afternoon, I believe that was the name on the return address. [_picks it up from the bookshelf_]

speaker: Frasier
text: What could he possibly be sending me?  Daphne, you've got longer nails than I have.

speaker: Daphne
text: Open it yourself. [_tosses it to him_]

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well, all right. _He sits on the couch and opens the package.  Inside is a small ornate box with a note._

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, what do you know?  It's my salt server.

speaker: Niles
text: I've heard you speak about it, but I had no idea it was so magnificent.

speaker: Frasier
text: Would you look at this beautiful gilding, and the exquisite but playful scrollwork.

speaker: Niles
text: And... it has a tiny spoon! [_lifts it out_]

speaker: Daphne
text: Aren't you going to read the note?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh yes, of course. [_Niles takes the server_] Thank you, Niles. [_reading_] "Frasier, I apologize for any trouble I've caused, and hope you'll forgive me."  He must think I've got turnips growing out of my ears!  He's after something!

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, hide the pepper.

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello, Crane residence.  Thank you. [_hangs up_] That was the doorman.  Mr. Sternin's on his way up.

speaker: Frasier
text: So much for living in a security building!

speaker: Daphne
text: Come on now, Dr. Crane, maybe he wants to make amends.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, let me acquaint you with the _curriculum vitae_ of Mr. Blaine Sternin--or "Brad Cunningham," as he's known in Maine, "Royce Thibideaux" in Loo-siana, and "Santana De La Cruz," the pride of Albuquerque, New _Mexico_!  This is a man who once made a living selling rare autographs, until it was discovered that Madame Curie and Sugar Ray Robinson had the same handwriting.  And would you care to see the deed to my 50,000-acre kelp farm?

speaker: Daphne
text: It's hard to believe a man of your intellect could be so fooled.

speaker: Frasier
text: It wasn't my intellect that he preyed upon, Daphne.  It was my kind and generous heart.  Well, not this time.  This time I will make it a stone.

speaker: Frasier
text: He may come swaggering in here, but I assure you, he will go slinking out with his tail between his legs! [_opens the door_] All right, Blaine...!

speaker: Blaine
text: Frasier, my brother.  It's been too long.

speaker: Frasier
text: Hello, Blaine.  A wheelchair?  Nice touch.

speaker: Blaine
text: Well, the truth is, I've been in a terrible accident.  I've lost all feeling from my waist down, the doctors tell me I'll be like this for the rest of my life--oh hi, everybody! Blaine Sternin.

speaker: Martin
text: Come on in, Marty Crane.

speaker: Blaine
text: Hey, hiya, Marty, how are you?

speaker: Daphne
text: Daphne Moon.

speaker: Blaine
text: Hey.

speaker: Niles
text: Niles Crane.

speaker: Blaine
text: Niles, how are you?

speaker: Frasier
text: [_still by the door_] Bravo, Blaine!  This is the best one yet! But you forget with whom you're dealing.  I've seen it all.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, the man is in a wheelchair!

speaker: Frasier
text: Which means that somewhere, someone is missing a wheelchair!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, if you don't believe him, why don't you call Lilith?

speaker: Frasier
text: Good idea. _He takes the phone to the hall.  Martin sits back down and Blaine wheels beside him._

speaker: Blaine
text: So, Martin, I see you also park in the blue zone.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, when I can.  But those spaces are always filled.

speaker: Blaine
text: Ah yeah, well that's probably partly my fault.  Boy, I sold a lot of fake handicapped plates in my time.  Boy, talk about a butt-load of poetic justice, huh?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, I believe that is the basic unit of poetic justice.

speaker: Niles
text: So, what did Lilith say?  Has Blaine really lost the use of his legs?

speaker: Frasier
text: She says she doesn't know, but hopes so.

speaker: Blaine
text: Well, all right, I guess there's only one way I can prove this to you.  Daphne, may I borrow that lovely pin you're wearing?

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, um... [_unfastens it_] let's see... here you go.

speaker: Blaine
text: All right, here you go, Fras, my man!  Stick it anywhere you'd like.

speaker: Frasier
text: You'd have to get up for that.

speaker: Blaine
text: All right, I guess I'll just do it myself. _He calmly stabs the pin into the flesh of his right thigh, without flinching.  Daphne, Niles, and Martin react._

speaker: Blaine
text: There you go.

speaker: Niles
text: That's disturbing.

speaker: Martin
text: Cool!

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, that is nothing but a cheap parlor trick!

speaker: Blaine
text: You know, I thought you'd take a little more convincing than that.  Daphne, would you have a butcher knife in the kitchen?

speaker: Martin
text: [_gets up_] Oh, I'll get it!

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, that's enough, Dad!  All right, Blaine, let's cut to the chase.  What's it going to cost me to get you out of here?

speaker: Blaine
text: You want to know something, Frasier, you're almost right. You're _almost_ right.  It's true.  I do want something from you.  But what I want... is for you to get down on your knees and pray with me.  I know these words sound strange, but I've had a deeply religious conversion.

speaker: Daphne
text: Really?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, this just gets better and better.

speaker: Blaine
text: I guess it started with my car accident.  I was driving drunk, which I had done one too many times.  You know, it was a sign.

speaker: Daphne
text: From God?

speaker: Blaine
text: No, from the highway department.  It said, "Lane Ends," and I just plowed right into it.  The next thing I saw was a bright light and a tunnel.

speaker: Daphne
text: So you had a near-death experience?

speaker: Blaine
text: No, it was a CAT scan.  You know, when Dr. Kagan told me I was paralyzed, well, I was devastated.  There I was, at the lowest point a man can be... and He came to me.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Kagan?

speaker: Blaine
text: No, wrong again, hon.  It was God.

speaker: Daphne
text: Oh, damn!

speaker: Niles
text: Hang in there, sweetheart, you'll get one.

speaker: Blaine
text: He showed me how I've squandered my life--you know, cheating innocent people.  I-I was just filled with shame.  And that's why I'm here, as a matter of fact.  I've started a ministry to save souls the way the Lord saved mine.

speaker: Frasier
text: What genius!  The Lord--a credible partner who doesn't take a cut!

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, you should be ashamed of yourself!  The fact that Mr. Sternin has turned his accident into something positive, well, it's one of the most inspirational stories I've ever heard.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, please!  You have no idea what this man is capable of-

speaker: Daphne
text: Sir, can I get you something to eat or drink?

speaker: Blaine
text: You know, I could use a beer.  I haven't given up everything.

speaker: Martin
text: That is inspiring!  Yeah, make it two, Daph.

speaker: Daphne
text: O.K.

speaker: Blaine
text: But I insist that I help.  It's like a thing with me, all of a sudden.  I just won't allow anyone to wait on me.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, you've just witnessed the first step in the Blaine Sternin long con.  He sets you up, sucks you in, and then bam!  Kelp futures.

speaker: Niles
text: Perhaps you're rushing to judgement, Frasier.  I know you two have a history, but isn't it possible that he's changed?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, don't be a sucker, Niles!  Dad, you're not buying any of this medicine show, are you?

speaker: Martin
text: Well, the guy is laying it on pretty thick, but I guess he could be on the level.  I mean, that pin thing was freaky. I want to get that on video.

speaker: Frasier
text: Daphne, you left him alone in the kitchen?  My sub-zero's probably on the way to a chop shop right now!

speaker: Frasier
text: All right, Blaine, I've had enough.  Get out.

speaker: Blaine
text: Frasier, look, I don't know how to prove this to you, but I swear all I really came for was your forgiveness--first of all, for stealing that little teapot.

speaker: Frasier
text: Salt server.

speaker: Blaine
text: Is that what that was?  Man, nobody knew.  And for all the times I lied and I cheated you, and for the time I posed as you and treated patients for a year-

speaker: Frasier
text: You what?!

speaker: Blaine
text: It was only a couple people, I'd tell you who they were, but you know we've got that doctor-patient confidentiality thing. [_Frasier puts a hand to his forehead_] The point is, that part of my life is over, Frasier.  I just--I don't know, I just want to give something back.

speaker: Frasier
text: Really?  If you wanted to give something back, you'd be mopping a soup kitchen, or reading to bedridden vets, or traveling to the Galapagos Islands to clean oil off some poor sea fowl, then maybe you'd have some credibility!

speaker: Blaine
text: I know I've given you so many reasons to mistrust me. But don't you believe that people can change?

speaker: Frasier
text: If I forgive you, will you leave and never return?

speaker: Blaine
text: Yes.  I promise you, you'll never see my face in this house again, unless I'm invited.

speaker: Frasier
text: Very well.  I grant you this boon, and I forgive you, now get out.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_enters_] Oh, Mr. Sternin, I hope you'll stay for dinner.

speaker: Blaine
text: Sounds like an invitation to me, Fras. _Frasier storms out.  END OF ACT ONE  ACT TWO  Scene Three - Apartment Blaine is sitting at the table with the Crane boys. Martin, and Niles are rapt, while Frasier keeps rolling his eyes._

speaker: Blaine
text: This kid, no more than fifteen years old, he lives in a cardboard box under the overpass, and his mother comes to me and begs me, "Will you get my kid off drugs...?"

speaker: Frasier
text: Yes, yes, and then you cured him, let's eat.

speaker: Blaine
text: No, no, no, you don't cure something like addiction overnight. Well, look who I'm telling, you're a psychiatrist.  You know.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, that's true.  I have found in my research with addictive personalities that... oh, for God's sake, what the hell am I doing?  There probably is no kid anyway!

speaker: Martin
text: Oh, Frasier, let up on the guy, he's a man of God.  Blaine, can I take a picture of you with a fork in your leg?

speaker: Daphne
text: All right, everybody, dig in.

speaker: Niles
text: That looks beautiful, Daphne...

speaker: Blaine
text: Well, who wants to say grace?

speaker: Niles
text: Oh... [_covering_] We almost forgot.

speaker: Daphne
text: [_covering_] Whose turn is it this time? [_everyone mumbles_]

speaker: Blaine
text: O.K., I will!  You want to join hands? _Blaine, Martin, Niles and Daphne join hands.  Blaine holds out his hand to Frasier.  Frasier holds up a "one second" finger, removes his watch from that wrist, and holds it in the hand that joins Daphne's before joining hands with Blaine._

speaker: Frasier
text: Ready.

speaker: Blaine
text: Dear Lord, bless this food, and this company.  Give us your guidance, and teach us to be forgiving, as you instructed your Apostles--

speaker: Frasier
text: I'll give you fifty bucks if you can name three of them!

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier!

speaker: Frasier
text: [_puts money on table_] Here you go, two twenties and a ten. Tell you what, I'll spot you John.

speaker: Daphne
text: Dr. Crane, we're in the middle of a prayer! [_to Blaine_] Please, go on.

speaker: Blaine
text: Thank you, Lord.  Amen. All but F: Amen.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_sullen_] Amen.

speaker: Blaine
text: You know, normally I get paid after I say grace.

speaker: Blaine
text: Nah, I'm kidding!

speaker: Niles
text: That was funny.

speaker: Blaine
text: Yeah, you know, you're a godless bunch, but I love you.

speaker: Frasier
text: You know, even worse than the godless are those who would use God for their own gain.  They are the true hypocrites, who should burn in the fiery hell for all eternity!

speaker: Blaine
text: Am I picking up a vibe here?

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, I'm sorry, did you think that was directed at you?

speaker: Blaine
text: You know, I could quote you chapter and verse all night to try to prove to you that I'm a changed man.  But you know what?  Instead, why don't you come see me in action on Sunday?

speaker: Niles
text: What do you mean?

speaker: Blaine
text: Come and hear me preach.  Witness what God can do through me in all His splendour and all His glory in the Regency room down at the airport Ramada.

speaker: Daphne
text: I'd love to go.

speaker: Martin
text: I wouldn't mind checking that out.

speaker: Niles
text: Sure, why not?

speaker: Blaine
text: Bless you people, that's just great, thank you very much. The only problem is, the advertising was just a skosh more than I thought, and I came up a thousand dollars short on the hall rental-

speaker: Frasier
text: A-ha!  The other shoe comes cascading from the sky!  One thousand dollars, you say?  Well, you're not getting it out of me, you born-again Bilko! [_to the others_] Didn't I tell you?

speaker: Blaine
text: Frasier, you know, what I was going to say if you'd let me finish was, somehow, the Lord will provide.  And by the way, [_rapidly_] Matthew, John and Thomas, Bartholomew, Jude, Judas, two Jameses, Andrew, Peter, Simon the Zealot, and Phillip. [_picks up the money_] $950 to go, pass the po-tah-toes, please. _Daphne does.  FADE TO:_ **THAT'S HOW THEY TALK IN SWEDEN** _Scene Four - Cafe Nervosa Frasier and Roz are sitting in the doorway booth._

speaker: Frasier
text: He says, "the Lord will provide" the money.  But we all know who that means--me!

speaker: Roz
text: You know, I always had a thing for evangelists.  When I first started out, I worked at this station back in Wisconsin. There was this young preacher who had a show of his own on Sunday mornings.  He spent hours trying to save my soul. [_chuckles at the memory_]

speaker: Frasier
text: And?

speaker: Roz
text: And it worked, and now I'm a nun.  What do you think happened?

speaker: Daphne
text: Hello.

speaker: Frasier
text: Oh, Daphne, Niles.

speaker: Daphne
text: Well, Dr. Crane, you needn't worry about Blaine asking you for money anymore.  He's received the thousand dollars he needs for Sunday.

speaker: Frasier
text: What nitwit gave him a thousand dollars?

speaker: Niles
text: Now, Frasier, that's not fair.  Perhaps whoever did it simply has a kind heart and a trusting nature that I, for one, find refreshing.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_after glaring at Niles_] Oh, Daphne...

speaker: Daphne
text: I come from a large family of scoundrels and n'er-do-wells, who repeatedly promised me they'd change their ways, and never made any effort.  Now here's someone who's actually trying, and succeeding.  Now I think that's worthy of a little encouragement.  Coffee, Niles?

speaker: Niles
text: Yes, please.

speaker: Frasier
text: I can't believe Daphne got snowed by that crook.  Now I've got to expose Blaine for the charlatan that he is. [_takes out cell phone_] What was the name of that doctor he said treated him in Laughlin?

speaker: Niles
text: Uh, it was... Kagan, if memory serves, Dr. Kagan.

speaker: Frasier
text: Shouldn't be too hard to find. [_speaking very slowly into phone_] Laughlin, Nevada.  Dr. Kagan. [_to Niles_] I'm being connected.

speaker: Niles
text: Frasier, you're sure you're not being a tad obsessive?

speaker: Frasier
text: Niles, this is about the truth. [_into phone_] Yes, hello? Uh, yes, Dr. Kagan, please.  Busy?  Too busy to talk with Dr. Frasier Crane, from [_fake European accent_] ze Nobel Prize Committee? _On Niles's look, we:  FADE TO:  Scene Five - Auditorium Blaine is preaching from a dais in an auditorium, speaking into a headset microphone.  Daphne, Martin, and Niles, are among the crowd._

speaker: Blaine
text: Now, you may ask yourself, "Why would THIS man spend the last hour preaching the word of God, look what God did to him!" Well, I'll tell you what God did to me.  He took away my legs, to show me how tall I can stand! _Assent from the crowd.  Martin, Niles, and Daphne are rapt with attention._

speaker: Blaine
text: Because until this happened, I was not a whole man.  I was a gambler, I was a liar, I was a cheat!  Everything you can imagine--that was me, I did it!  Ooh, I was a BAD man.  Go ahead, name something! Woman: A thief!

speaker: Blaine
text: Oh, a thief!  Not a day passed that I wasn't.  Anybody else, come on! Man: A womanizer!

speaker: Blaine
text: [_snorts_] Yeah, in between affairs. 2nd Woman: A tax evader!

speaker: Blaine
text: Yeah, but that was on principle.

speaker: Frasier
text: Come on, little sheep.  Come on into this nice little pen.

speaker: Daphne
text: Shh!

speaker: Martin
text: I thought you weren't coming.

speaker: Frasier
text: I just can't stand to see people get fleeced. I have left half a dozen messages for this so-called doctor of his.  I'll tell you what, the guy comes back with a different excuse every time why he can't come to the phone.  Niles, I tell you, there is no such man as this Dr. Kagan.  He doesn't exist!

speaker: Blaine
text: And yet, for the first time in my life I'm a happy man.  Oh, I can't dance the way I used to, but you know, my heart's turning cartwheels.  I can't run, but there's no need to hide anymore.  I can't make love, but I can feel love.  Now, do you want that kind of happiness?  Because if you do, let me hear you say, "Yeah!" Crowd: Yeah!

speaker: Blaine
text: Come on, like you really mean it!  Yeah! Crowd: Yeah!

speaker: Blaine
text: Are you willing to do whatever it takes?  Are you willing to make these earthly sacrifices to make heavenly gains? _As the crowd's chorus of "Yeah!" rises, Frasier stands up and bleats like a sheep._

speaker: Frasier
text: BAAAAAAA!  Have you people lost your senses?  Do you hear yourselves?  This is no man of God!  He's a huckster!

speaker: Martin
text: Frasier, sit down!  This is why I hate going anywhere with you.

speaker: Frasier
text: This charade has got to stop right now!  I will not allow these good people to be bamboozled!

speaker: Blaine
text: No, no, people, it's all right.  He belongs up here.  He's one of God's creatures.

speaker: Frasier
text: I am no such thing!  I will prove once and for all that this man is a fraud!  See for yourselves! _He grabs Blaine's wheelchair and tips him onto the floor.  The crowd gasps, and the people in the front row start forward._

speaker: Frasier
text: No, no, no, don't help him!  That's enough of this, Blaine! Get up!  GET UP!

speaker: Blaine
text: Wait, people.  He knows not what he does.

speaker: Frasier
text: What?! ...Yes, Dr. Kagan.  Yes, I did.  Uh-huh... uh-huh... For life.  I see, thank you. [_hangs up_] Well, it seems an apology is in order.  Please, help me get this man back into his chair. [_the people do_] And I will match all contributions to this man's ministry here today, dollar for dollar!  You want fulfillment, you want inner peace, this is your man right here: Blaine Sternin!  Come on, dig deep!  Brother Niles, you've been richly blessed! _Niles' eyes widen furiously at Frasier putting him on the spot, but Daphne elbows him.  He takes out his wallet as everyone else reaches for their wallets and purses.  FADE TO:  Scene Six - Apartment Frasier and Martin are standing over Blaine by the front door._

speaker: Blaine
text: Thanks again for paying in cash there, Fras.  I'd rather see that money go to poor people than, you know, Uncle Sam.

speaker: Frasier
text: It's my pleasure to do it.  Blaine, there's something I'd like you to have. _He goes to the curio cabinet by the door and takes out the box with the salt server in it.  He gives it to Blaine._

speaker: Blaine
text: Well... well, thanks.  You know, this is, uh, this is really gonna help some needy people now that I know what the heck it is.

speaker: Blaine
text: Martin, it's been a pleasure, my man.

speaker: Martin
text: [_shakes his hand_] Oh, same here, Blaine.  Good luck to you.

speaker: Blaine
text: Well, thanks a lot.

speaker: Frasier
text: [_extends his hand_] Blaine, you are welcome in my home any time.

speaker: Blaine
text: [_moved, shakes his hand_] Well, thank you, Frasier.  That means a lot to me.  God bless you.  Well, I'm off to spread the good word.

speaker: Frasier
text: Right. [_opens the door_] You are indeed a "holy roller."

speaker: Blaine
text: [_chuckles_] Yeah.  Yeah, that's good.

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, there was a lesson learned.

speaker: Martin
text: Yeah, don't throw a guy out of a wheelchair.  Who knew?

speaker: Frasier
text: Well, I guess I just needed a reminder that people really are capable of change. [_sits on the couch_]

speaker: Martin
text: [_sits in his Chair_] Well, I got to be honest with you.  I wasn't totally convinced myself until I saw him on stage. Before you came in, he was talking about all these things he did right after his conversion.  Man, that guy was committed. He mopped up soup kitchens.  He read to bedridden veterans. He even went to the Galapagos Islands to help clean the old off some fowls!

speaker: Frasier
text: He said that, did he? _He rushes to the door, pulls it open--and gasps when he sees the wheelchair sitting vacant in the hallway._
